translations.translation: and raised its vault high and proportioned it;
He raised its roof and made it proper.
He raised its hei- ght, and has perfected it.
He raised high its height, then put it into a right good state.
He lifted up its vault, and levelled it,
He raised the height thereof and ordered it;
by raising its vault high and fashioning it flawlessly,
He hath raised the height thereof and perfected it.
He raised its vault and fashioned it,
On high hath He raised its canopy, and He hath given it order and perfection.
He raised its height, and He has equally ordered it,
He raised it high and leveled it,
He raised its masses, and proportioned it.
He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.

[79:28] He made it rise high — an explication of the manner of [its] construction; in other words, He made its vertical extension high; it is also said that samkahā means ‘its ceiling’ — and levelled it: He made it even, flawless,
He raised the height) its ceiling (thereof and ordered it) above the earth;

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا } معناه بَناها بغَيرِ عَمدٍ، يعني السّماءَ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وأحسن بناءها، حيث { رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا } وسقفها بلا أعمدة وأسانيد واسطوانات { فَسَوَّاهَا } [النازعات: 28] وعدلها بلا قصور وفتور

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { رَفَعَ سَمْكَها } أي: أعلى سقفها من الأرض، وذهب بها إلى سمت العلوّ مدًّا رفيعاً مسيرة خمسمائة عام { فسوّاها } أي: فعدّلها مستوية ملساء، ليس فيها تفاوت ولا فطور، أو: تممها بما جعل فيها من الكواكب والدراري، وغيرها مما لا يعلمه إلاَّ الخلاَّق العليم، من قولهم: سوَّى فلان أمره: إذا أصلحه
